intro: Obione tenuissima, commonly known as the slender obione, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Obione tenuissima is considered a species of conservation concern.
